definition: noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)

sentences.english: Construction cranes clutter the skylines of booming Chinese cities.
sentences.chinese: 繁榮城市的工地上起重機鬧哄哄。

sentences.english: It sounds like they were killing cats, but beyond that, it was a hoot.
sentences.chinese: 聽起來像是他們正在殺貓，除此之外，鬧哄哄的。

sentences.english: The children piled noisily into the bus .
sentences.chinese: 孩子們鬧哄哄地擠上了公共汽車。

sentences.english: The meeting was a noisy affair.
sentences.chinese: 這次會議開得鬧哄哄的。
